input_text:
Job Title: Specialist Operations Lead

Location: Dolton, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description

Safety-Kleen in Dolton, IL is currently looking for a Specialist Operations Leadto join their team! As a Specialist Operations Lead you will perform hands on operations. This is a great opportunity for college students or recent high school grads wanting to gain some work experience.

Why work for Safety-Kleen

Health and Safety is our #1 priority and we live it 3-6-5!Competitive wagesMonday-Friday scheduleComprehensive health benefits coverage after 30 days of full-time employmentGroup 401K with company matching componentGenerous paid time off, company paid training and tuition reimbursementOpportunities for growth and development for all the stages of your career

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

Seeking an individual with a commitment to safety, experience in working with Tank Farms (opening closing valves, blowing down lines, etc.) and an ability to lift up to 50 lbs. (handling various materials). Forklift experience is preferred, but not required.

Responsibilities To Include

 Leading a team of 2 colleagues offering guidance and instruction as needed to keep the operation moving. Commitment to operating within CHES safety policies/procedures Loading (product/supplies) and unloading (waste containers) from Dolton Branch route trucks daily. Ensuring compliance in EPA & DOT regulations by confirming accuracy of container labeling, proper container closure and Daily reconciliation of all CWT (Containerized Waste Tracking) containers that were unloaded during the shift. Dumping dirty Mineral Spirits containers unloaded from the day's services and the Mothership program. Rinsing and refilling emptied containers to produce inventory "Stock" for Dolton services and Mothership.

Qualifications

What does it take to work at Safety-Kleen?

 High School diploma or equivalent required;  Must be 18 years or older;  1+ Years of related experience;  Fork lift experience preferred (Not Required);  Ability to use computer;  Ability to lift 50 or more pounds; 

Safety-Kleen, a Clean Harbors company, has a commitment to excellence deeply rooted in a strong sense of tradition. Our entire business model revolves around keeping North American businesses green. We generate more than $1.2 billion in annual revenue as a world-class environmental service organization and market leader in industrial hazardous waste management, parts-cleaning technology, and oil re-refining. We collect over 200 million gallons of used motor oil each year and we have the largest re-refinery capacity in North America allowing us to re-refine more than 150 million gallons each year.

Every day, we help our customers resolve their waste management needs and reduce their carbon footprint. PROTECTION. CHOICES. PEOPLE. MAKE GREEN WORK.â„¢

Clean Harbors is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ancestry, color, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or on the basis of any other federal, state/provincial or local protected class.

Clean Harbors and its subsidiaries are a Military & Veteran friendly company.

SKCH

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
